name: ClockGate
desc: A generic and configurable clock gating block.

desc:
Constructs a clock gating block where enable controls whether the
gatedClk is connected directly to the freeClk or is gated off.

Registers a signal as an input to this Module and returns an input
port that can be consumed.

name: addOutput
desc:
Registers an output to this Module and returns an output port that
can be driven by this Module or consumed outside of it.

name: controlled
desc:
Returns a (potentially) delayed (by one cycle) version of original if
delayControlledSignals is true and the clock gating isPresent. This
is the signal that should be used as inputs to logic depending on the
gatedClk.

name: delayControlledSignals
desc:
Indicates whether the controlled signals are delayed by 1 cycle. If this
is false, or clock gating is not isPresent, then the controlled
signals are not delayed.

name: gatedClk
desc: The gated clock output.

name: isPresent
desc:
Indicates whether the clock gating is present. If it is not present, then
the gatedClk is directly connected to the free clock and the
controlled signals are not delayed.

used to replicate interface configuration through hierarchies to carry
configuration information.

desc: Capture the additional ports that are part of this interface, if any.

Creates a clone of with the same configuration, including any
additionalPorts and gatedClockGenerator function. This should be used
to replicate interface configuration through hierarchies to carry
configuration information.

A default implementation for clock gating, effectively just an AND of the

desc:
If asserted, then clocks will be enabled regardless of the enable
signal.

A function that generates the gated clock signal based on the provided

desc: Whether an enableOverride is present on this interface.

name: isPresent
desc:
Indicates whether clock gating logic isPresent or not. If it is not,
then no clock gating will occur and no clock gating logic will be
generated.

Keeps a count of the running sum of any number of sources with optional
configuration for widths, saturation behavior, and restarting.

desc: Creates a counter that increments according to the provided interfaces.

desc:
Creates a Counter that counts up by all of the provided logics,
including much of the other available configuration in the default
constructor.

desc:
A simplified constructor for Counter that accepts a single fixed amount
to count by (up or down based on increments) along with much of the
other available configuration in the default Counter constructor.

name: Counter.upDown
desc:
A simplified constructor for Counter that accepts a single fixed amount
to count by along with much of the
other available configuration in the default Counter constructor.
And allows for both incrementing and decrementing the count.

desc: Whether the reset is asynchronous.

desc: Builds the flops that store the count.

desc: The main clock signal.

desc:
If the provided maxValue was a constant, then this will be the constant
value. Otherwise, it will be null.

name: constantMinValue
desc:
If the provided minValue was a constant, then this will be the constant
value. Otherwise, it will be null.

name: count
desc: The output value of the counter.

desc:
Indicates whether the sum (including potential saturation) is currently
equal to the maximum.

name: equalsMin
desc:
Indicates whether the sum (including potential saturation) is currently
equal to the minimum.

name: initialValueLogic
desc: An internal Logic version of the provided initial value.

name: interfaces
desc: The "internal" versions of the SumInterfaces for this computation.

name: maxValueLogic
desc: An internal Logic version of the provided maximum value.

name: minValueLogic
desc: An internal Logic version of the provided minimum value.

desc:

resulting value depends on the provided saturates behavior (staturation
or overflow).

name: reset
desc: The reset signal.

name: restart
desc: The restart signal.

name: saturates
desc:
If true, will saturate at the maxValue and minValue. If false,
will wrap around (overflow/underflow) at the maxValue and minValue.

name: summer
desc: The internal Sum that is used to keep track of the count.

name: underflowed
desc:
Indicates whether the sum is less than the minimum value. The actual
resulting value depends on the provided saturates behavior (saturation
or underflow).

name: width
desc: The width of the resulting sum.

name: operator *
desc:
Multiplication operation that returns a FixedPointValue.
The result is signed if one of the operands is signed.
The result fraction width is the sum of fraction widths of operands.

name: operator +
desc:
Addition operation that returns a FixedPointValue.
The result is signed if one of the operands is signed.
The result integer has the max integer width of the operands plus one.
The result fraction has the max fractional width of the operands.

name: operator -
desc:
Subtraction operation that returns a FixedPointValue.
The result is always signed.
The result integer has the max integer width of the operands plus one.
The result fraction has the max fractional width of the operands.

name: operator /
desc:
Division operation that returns a FixedPointValue.
The result is signed if one of the operands is signed.
The result integer width is the sum of dividend integer width and divisor
fraction width. The result fraction width is the sum of dividend fraction
width and divisor integer width.

name: FixedToFloat
desc:
FixedToFloat converts a fixed point input to floating point with
rouding to nearest even. If the input exceeds the floating point range,
the output will be infinity. E4M3 is not supported as this format doesn't
support infinity.

name: FixedToFloat.new
desc:
Constructor for fixed to floating-point conversion. This component takes
a fixed point input number to convert, producing a floating-point output
float.  The number can be specified as signed (true by default). The
leadingDigitPredict pposition can optionally be provided which avoids
having to do a full leading-digit scan for conversion. This provided value
must be within 1 of the actual final leading one (after absolute value) of
the input fixed-point number. A LeadingDigitAnticipate module can be
used to provide this value from two inputs to an adder producing the
fixed-point value input to this converter.

name: Float8ToFixed
desc:
Float8ToFixed converts an 8-bit floating point (FP8) input
to a signed fixed-point output following Q notation (Qm.n) as introduced by
(Texas Instruments): (https://www.ti.com/lit/ug/spru565b/spru565b.pdf).
FP8 input must follow E4M3 or E5M2 as described in
(FP8 formats for deep learning): (https://arxiv.org/pdf/2209.05433).
This component offers re-using the same hardware for both FP8 formats.
Infinities and NaN's are not supported.
The output is of type Logic and in two's complement.
It can be cast to a FixedPoint by the consumer based on the mode.
if mode is true:
  Input is treated as E4M3 and converted to Q9.9

name: FloatingPointAdder
desc: An abstract API for floating point adders.

name: FloatingPointAdder.new
desc:
Add two floating point numbers a and b, returning result in sum. If
a different output type is needed, you can provide that in outSum.

name: a
desc: The first addend a, named this way to allow for a local variable 'a'.

name: b
desc: The second addend b, named this way to allow for a local variable 'b'.

name: clk
desc:
The clk : if a non-null clock signal is passed in, a pipestage is added
to the adder to help optimize frequency.

name: enable
desc:
Optional enable, used only if a clk is not null to enable the pipeline
flops.

name: exponentWidth
desc: Width of the output exponent field.

name: internalSum
desc:
The conditional output FloatingPoint signal in which to store the
result of the addition.

name: localFlop
desc: Pipelining helper that uses the context for signals clk/enable/reset

name: mantissaWidth
desc: Width of the output mantissa field.

name: reset
desc:
Optional reset, used only if a clk is not null to reset the pipeline
flops.

name: roundingMode
desc: The rounding mode to use for the adder.

name: sum
desc: getter for the computed FpTypeOut output.

name: FloatingPointValue
desc:
A flexible representation of floating point values. A FloatingPointValue
has a mantissa in [0,2) with 0 <= exponent <= maxExponent();  A value
which FloatingPointValue.isNormal has minExponent() <= exponent <= maxExponent() and a mantissa in the range of [1,2).  Subnormal numbers
are represented with a zero exponent and leading zeros in the mantissa
capture the negative exponent value.

name: FloatingPointValue.new
desc:
Constructor for a FloatingPointValue with the provided sign,
exponent, and mantissa.

name: FloatingPointValue.uninitialized
desc:
Creates an unpopulated version of a FloatingPointValue, intended to be
called with the populator.

name: abs
desc: Absolute value operation for FloatingPointValue.

name: bias
desc:
Return the bias of this FloatingPointValue, the offset of the
exponent, also representing the zero exponent 2^0 = 1.

name: canonicalize
desc:
Return the cananocalized form of FloatingPointValue which
has the leading 1 at the front of the mantissa, or further right if
subnormal.

name: clonePopulator
desc:
Creates a FloatingPointValuePopulator for the same type as this and
with the same widths.

name: compareTo
desc: Floating point comparison to implement Comparable.

name: explicitJBit
desc: Return true if the JBit is explicitly represented in the mantissa.

name: exponent
desc:
The exponent of the FloatingPointValue: this is biased about a midpoint

name: exponentWidth
desc: The exponent width.

name: getSpecialConstantComponents
desc:
Returns a tuple of LogicValues for the sign, exponent, and
mantissa components of a special constant, or null if the constant
does not have special components.This is useful for constants like NaN,
infinity, etc., in certain types of floating point representations.

name: hashCode
desc: The hash code for this object.

name: isAZero
desc:
Return true if the represented floating point number is zero. Note
that the equality operator will treat
FloatingPointConstants.positiveZero
and FloatingPointConstants.negativeZero as equal.

name: isAnInfinity
desc:
Return true if the represented floating point number is considered
 infinity or negative infinity.

name: isExponentAllOnes
desc: Test if exponent is all '1's.

name: isExponentAllZeros
desc: Test if exponent is all '0's.

name: isLegalValue
desc: Check if the mantissa and exponent stored are compatible.

name: isMantissaAllZeroes
desc: Test if mantissa is all '0's.

name: isNaN
desc:
Return true if the represented floating point number is considered
NaN or "Not a Number".

name: isNormal
desc:
Return true if this FloatingPointValue contains a normal
number, defined as having mantissa in the range [1,2).

name: isSubnormal
desc:
Return true if the represented floating point number is considered
"subnormal", including isAZero.

name: mantissa
desc: The mantissa of the floating point.

name: mantissaWidth
desc: The mantissa width.

name: maxExponent
desc: Return the maximum exponent of this FloatingPointValue.

name: minExponent
desc: Return the minimum exponent of this FloatingPointValue.

name: negate
desc: Negate operation for FloatingPointValue.

name: operator *
desc: Multiply operation for FloatingPointValue.

name: operator +
desc: Addition operation for FloatingPointValue.

name: operator -
desc: Subtract operation for FloatingPointValue.

name: operator /
desc: Divide operation for FloatingPointValue.

name: operator <
desc: Less-than operator for FloatingPointValue.

name: operator <=
desc: Less-than-or-equal operator for FloatingPointValue.

name: operator ==
desc: Equality operator for FloatingPointValue.

name: operator >
desc: Greater-than operator for FloatingPointValue.

name: operator >=
desc: Greater-than-or-equal operator for FloatingPointValue.

name: operator unary-
desc: Negate the FloatingPointValue.

name: populator
desc:
Creates a FloatingPointValuePopulator with the provided exponentWidth

name: sign
desc: The sign of the FloatingPointValue: 1 means a negative value.

name: subNormalAsZero
desc: Return true if subnormal numbers are treated as zero.

subtraction). Pairs of prediction outputs (leadingOne/validLeadOne and
leadingOneConverse/validLeadOneConverse) for the operation on a and
b inputs are produced. These appropriate prediction pair can be selected
outside the module by looking at the end-around-carry of a
ones-complement: Essentially, leadingOne should be used if a

name: leadingOneConverse
desc: The number of zeros for the converse case (when subtracting)

name: validLeadOneConverse
desc: If the converse case is valid.

name: LeadingZeroAnticipateBase
desc: Base class for leading-zero anticipate modules.

name: LeadingZeroAnticipateBase.new
desc:
Construct a leading-zero anticipate module that predicts the number of
leading zeros in the sum of a and b.  The output leadingOne holds
the position of the leading '1' (or, equivalently, the number of leading
zeros) that are predicted.  This prediction can be exact or 1 position
less than the leading zero of the sum or subtraction of a and b.
validLeadOne indicates a leading one was found.

name: a
desc: The value of input a.

name: aSign
desc: The sign of input a.

name: b
desc: The value of input b.

name: bSign
desc: The sign of input b.

name: leadOneEncoder
desc: The predictor used for the computation of a operation with b.

name: leadOneEncoderConverse
desc: The predictor used for the computation of b operation with a.

name: leadingOne
desc: The number of zeros or position of leading 1.

name: validLeadOne
desc: If the leadingOne output is valid.

name: LeadingZeroAnticipateCarry
desc:
Module for predicting the number of leading zeros (position of leading 1)
before an addition or subtraction.

name: LeadingZeroAnticipateCarry.new
desc:
Construct a leading-zero anticipate module that predicts the number of
leading zeros in the addition or subtraction of a and b.  Provide the
endAroundCarry from the ones-complement operation to select the proper
prediction pair. and output as leadingOne and validLeadOne.

name: LogicList
desc: Helper evaluation methods for printing aligned arithmetic bitvectors.

name: listString
desc:
Print aligned bitvector with an optional header from List<Logic>.
name is printed at the LHS of the line, trimmed by prefix.
prefix is the distance from the margin bebore the vector is printed.
alignHigh is highest column (MSB) to which to align
alignLow will trim the vector below this bit position (LSB).
shift will allow you to shift your list positions
You can insert a separator sepChar at position sepPos.
A header can be printed by setting header to true.
Markdown format can be produced by setting markDown to true.
The output can have space by setting extraSpace
if intValue is true, then the integer value (signed version in parens)
will be printed at the end of the vector.

name: ReductionTree.new
desc:
Generate a tree based on dividing the input sequence of a node into
segments, recursively constructing radix child nodes to operate on each
segment.

name: controlOut
desc: The control output of the tree computation.

name: depth
desc: The depth of the tree from the output to the leaves.

name: depthBetweenFlops
desc: Specified depth of nodes at which to flop (requires _clk).

name: latency
desc: The number of flops from the output to the leaves.

name: operation
desc:
Operation to be performed at each node. Note that operation can widen
the output. The logic function must support the operation for 2 and up to
radix inputs. The depth input is the depth of the current node in the
tree to the leaves.  For sequences that are not powers of radix, the
depth is the maximum depth to the leaves from this node in the tree.  The
depth can be used to index the control Logic to change behavior at
each depth of the tree.

name: out
desc: The final output of the tree computation.

name: radix
desc: Specified width of input to each reduction node (e.g., binary: radix=2)

name: signExtensionParameter
desc: Configuration for signed extension of values in the tree.

desc:
Registers a signal as an inOut to this Module and returns an inOut
port that can be consumed inside this Module. The type of the port will
be LogicType and constructed via Logic.clone, so it is required that
the source implements clone functionality that matches the type and
properly updates the Logic.name as well.

name: addTypedInput
desc:
Registers a signal as an input to this Module and returns an input
port that can be consumed. The type of the port will be LogicType and
constructed via Logic.clone, so it is required that the source
implements clone functionality that matches the type and properly updates
the Logic.name as well.

name: addTypedOutput
desc:
Registers an output to this Module and returns an output port that
can be driven by this Module or consumed outside of it. The type of the
port will be LogicType and constructed via logicGenerator, which must
properly update the name of the generated LogicType as well.

name: RippleCarryAdder
desc:
An RippleCarryAdder is a digital circuit used for binary addition. It
consists of a series of full adders connected in a chain, with the carry
output of each adder linked to the carry input of the next one. Starting
from the least significant bit (LSB) to most significant bit (MSB), the
adder sequentially adds corresponding bits of two binary numbers.

name: StaticOrRuntimeParameter
desc:
A general configuration class for specifying parameters that are
for both static or runtime configurations of a component feature.

name: StaticOrRuntimeParameter.new
desc:
Creates a new StaticOrRuntimeParameter instance. Note that
runtimeConfig overrides staticConfig.  Also, it is presumed that
staticConfig has a default value of false if not provided.

name: StaticOrRuntimeParameter.ofDynamic
desc:
Factory constructor to create a StaticOrRuntimeParameter instance from a
dynamic.

name: getLogic
desc:
Return the internal Logic signal that represents the configuration,
either static or runtime.

name: getRuntimeInput
desc:
Construct and return a Logic? that is a true input to the module
if this is a runtime configuration signal.

name: name
desc:
The name of the configuration, especially needed for runtime to add as
a module input.

name: runtimeConfig
desc:
The runtime configuration logic that can be used to configure the
component at runtime

name: staticConfig
desc:
The static configuration flag that indicates whether the
feature is statically configured or not.

name: toString
desc: Return a string representation of the configuration, including its name.

name: tryRuntimeInput
desc: Returns a Logic? that represents the module internalruntime input.

name: value
desc: Return a bool representing the value of the configuration.

name: StopBitsSignExtension
desc: A StopBits Sign Extension.

name: StopBitsSignExtension.new
desc: Construct a stop bits sign extendsion class.

name: signExtend
desc:
Sign extend the PP array using stop bits.
If possible, fold the final carry into another row (only when rectangular
enough that carry bit lands outside another row).
This technique can then be combined with a first-row extension technique
for folding in the final carry.

name: StringConfigKnob
desc: A knob for holding a String.

name: StringConfigKnob.new
desc: Creates a new knob with the specified initial value.

name: setValueFromString
desc: Sets the value from a String.

name: SubNormalAsZeroSelecKnob
desc: Set of knobs for subnormal treatment.

name: SubNormalAsZeroSelecKnob.new
desc: Creates a new knob for setting up subnormal treatment.

name: denormalAsZeroA
desc: Treat input 'a' as zero when subnormal.

name: denormalAsZeroB
desc: Treat input 'b' as zero when subnormal.

name: flushToZero
desc: If addition output is subnormal, flush to zero.

name: subKnobs
desc: Create the knobs for adder selection.

name: Sum
desc:
Computes a sum of any number of sources with optional configuration for
widths and saturation behavior.

name: Sum.new
desc: Computes a sum across the provided interfaces.

name: Sum.ofLogics
desc: Computes a Sum across the provided logics.

name: constantMaxValue
desc:
If the provided maxValue was a constant, then this will be the constant
value. Otherwise, it will be null.

name: constantMinValue
desc:
If the provided minValue was a constant, then this will be the constant
value. Otherwise, it will be null.

name: equalsMax
desc:
Indicates whether the sum (including potential saturation) is currently
equal to the maximum.

name: equalsMin
desc:
Indicates whether the sum (including potential saturation) is currently
equal to the minimum.

name: initialValueLogic
desc: An internal Logic version of the provided initial value.

name: interfaces
desc: The "internal" versions of the SumInterfaces for this computation.

name: maxValueLogic
desc: An internal Logic version of the provided maximum value.

name: minValueLogic
desc: An internal Logic version of the provided minimum value.

name: overflowed
desc:
Indicates whether the sum is greater than the maximum value. The actual
resulting value depends on the provided saturates behavior (staturation
or overflow).

name: saturates
desc:
If true, will saturate at the maxValue and minValue. If false,
will wrap around (overflow/underflow) at the maxValue and minValue.

name: sum
desc: The resulting sum.

name: underflowed
desc:
Indicates whether the sum is less than the minimum value. The actual
resulting value depends on the provided saturates behavior (saturation
or underflow).

name: width
desc: The width of the resulting sum.

name: SumConfigurator
desc: A configurator for Sum.

name: createModule
desc: Creates a Module instance as configured.

name: initialValueKnob
desc: The initial value.

name: knobs
desc:
A mapping from configuration names to ConfigKnobs that can be used
to configure this component.

name: name
desc: The name of this Configurator.

name: SumInterface
desc:
A PairInterface representing an amount and behavior for inclusion in a
sum or count.

name: SumInterface.clone
desc: Creates a clone of this SumInterface for things like pairConnectIO.

name: SumInterface.new
desc:
Creates a new SumInterface with a fixed or variable amount, optionally
with an enable, in either positive or negative direction based on
increments.

name: amount
desc: The amount to increment/decrement by, depending on increments.

name: clone
desc:
Create a clone of the SumInterface with the same configuration,
including any fixedAmount, increments, and hasEnable properties.

name: enable
desc:
Controls whether it should increment or decrement (based on increments)
(active high).

name: fixedAmount
desc: If non-null, the constant value of amount.

name: hasEnable
desc: Whether an enable signal is present on this interface.

name: increments
desc: If true, will increment. If false,  will decrement.

name: toString
desc: A string representation of this object.

name: width
desc: The width of the amount.

name: SumInterfaceKnob
desc: A knob for a single sum interface.

name: SumInterfaceKnob.new
desc: Creates a new sum interface knob.

name: fixedValueKnob
desc:
The fixed value of the sum interface, only present when isFixedValueKnob
is true.

name: hasEnableKnob
desc: Whether the sum interface has an enable signal.

name: incrementsKnob
desc: Whether the sum interface increments (vs. decrements).

name: isFixedValueKnob
desc: Whether the sum interface has a fixed value.

name: subKnobs
desc: A mapping from a sub-knob name to a corresponding sub-ConfigKnob.

name: widthKnob
desc: The width of the sum interface.

name: SummationConfigurator
desc: A configurator for a module like SummationBase.

name: knobs
desc:
A mapping from configuration names to ConfigKnobs that can be used
to configure this component.

name: maxValueKnob
desc: The maximum value.

name: minValueKnob
desc: The minimum value.

name: saturatesKnob
desc: Whether the output saturates (vs. rolling over/under).

name: sumInterfaceKnobs
desc: The interface knobs.

name: widthKnob
desc: The width.

name: Synchronizer

name: Synchronizer.new
desc: Constructs a Synchronizer with the specified parameters.

name: numStages
desc: The number of synchronization stages (flip-flops).

name: stages
desc: Hides intermediate stages to prevent CDC violations.

name: syncData
desc: The synchronized output signal in the destination clock domain.

name: TextConfigKnob
desc:
A configuration knob for use in Configurators which can be configured by
text.

name: TextConfigKnob.new
desc: Creates a new knob with an initial value.

name: allowEmpty
desc: Whether the knob allows an empty string as input.

name: setValueFromString
desc: Sets the value from a String.

name: valueString
desc: A String representation of the value.

name: ToggleConfigKnob
desc: A knob for holding a bool.

name: ToggleConfigKnob.new
desc: Creates a new knob with the specified initial value.

name: ToggleGate
desc: A gate for signals to avoid toggling when not needed.

name: ToggleGate.new
desc:
Constructs a ToggleGate to reduce power consumption by reducing toggling
of the gatedData signal when enable is not asserted.

name: gatedData
desc:
The gated version of original data which will only toggle when the gate is
enabled.

desc: Top level module for computing binary to one-hot using recursion

name: TrivialCompoundAdder

desc: Constructs a CompoundAdder.

name: condFlop
desc: Conditionally constructs a positive edge triggered flip condFlop on clk.

name: currySignExtensionFunction
desc: Used to test different sign extension methods

name: isPowerOfTwo
desc: Returns whether n is a power of two.

name: largestPow2LessThan
desc: This computes the power of 2 less than x

name: log2Ceil
desc: Computes the bit width needed to store w addresses.

name: swap
desc: Swap two Logic structures based on a conditional doSwap.
